events.name: Russia becomes most sanctioned country
events.wd_description: Russia has become the world's most sanctioned country with over 10,500 restrictions imposed on individuals and businesses, with 7,500 implemented in the last four months.
events.description: Russia has become the world's most sanctioned country with over 10,500 restrictions imposed on individuals and businesses, with 7,500 implemented in the last four months.

events.name: Impact of sanctions on Russia
events.wd_description: The sanctions have affected Russia's newly manufactured cars, which lack imported security technologies, and have led to reduced traffic and choice of products in malls.
events.description: The sanctions have affected Russia's newly manufactured cars, which lack imported security technologies, and have led to reduced traffic and choice of products in malls.

events.name: China's stance on sanctions
events.wd_description: China, Russia's prominent ally, has stated it will not supply Russia with sanctioned technology due to fear of secondary sanctions.
events.description: China, Russia's prominent ally, has stated it will not supply Russia with sanctioned technology due to fear of secondary sanctions.

events.name: Historical context of sanctions
events.wd_description: Sanctions against Russia have ramped up since 2014, but Russia is making huge gains from oil revenues, which can fund its military and prevent a spike in local unemployment.
events.description: Sanctions against Russia have ramped up since 2014, but Russia is making huge gains from oil revenues, which can fund its military and prevent a spike in local unemployment.

events.name: South Korea to boost defense capabilities
events.wd_label: South Korea to boost defense capabilities
events.wd_description: South Korean Defense Minister Lee Jong-sup announced plans to boost defense capabilities by working with the US and Japan to counter North Korea’s nuclear and missile threat.
events.description: South Korean Defense Minister Lee Jong-sup announced plans to boost defense capabilities by working with the US and Japan to counter North Korea’s nuclear and missile threat.

events.name: Urging North Korea to end programs
events.wd_label: Urging North Korea to end programs
events.wd_description: Lee urged North Korea to end its nuclear weapon and missile programs during an Asian security meeting in Singapore.
events.description: Lee urged North Korea to end its nuclear weapon and missile programs during an Asian security meeting in Singapore.

events.name: Strengthening defense capabilities
events.wd_description: Lee stated that South Korea will strengthen capabilities to better implement the US extended deterrence and enhance response capabilities to deter North Korea’s threats.
events.description: Lee stated that South Korea will strengthen capabilities to better implement the US extended deterrence and enhance response capabilities to deter North Korea’s threats.

events.name: Security cooperation with US and Japan
events.wd_label: Security cooperation with US and Japan
events.wd_description: Lee expressed interest in strengthening security cooperation between South Korea, the US, and Japan to respond to North Korea’s nuclear and missile programs.
events.description: Lee expressed interest in strengthening security cooperation between South Korea, the US, and Japan to respond to North Korea’s nuclear and missile programs.

events.name: Economic support for North Korea
events.wd_description: Lee mentioned that South Korea is ready to extend economic support if North Korea makes substantial progress in ending its nuclear program.
events.description: Lee mentioned that South Korea is ready to extend economic support if North Korea makes substantial progress in ending its nuclear program.

events.name: Sweden and Finland's NATO membership bid
events.wd_label: Sweden and Finland's NATO membership bid
events.wd_description: Sweden and Finland's bid to join NATO requires unanimous agreement by all current members, but Turkey's President Erdogan opposes the move due to past sanctions and alleged support for the Kurdistan Workers' Party.
events.description: Sweden and Finland's bid to join NATO requires unanimous agreement by all current members, but Turkey's President Erdogan opposes the move due to past sanctions and alleged support for the Kurdistan Workers' Party.

events.name: Turkey's opposition
events.wd_description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan opposed Sweden and Finland's bid to join NATO, citing sanctions placed on Turkey and their alleged support for the Kurdistan Workers' Party.
events.description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan opposed Sweden and Finland's bid to join NATO, citing sanctions placed on Turkey and their alleged support for the Kurdistan Workers' Party.

events.name: Statements from Sweden and Finland
events.wd_description: The Finnish foreign minister stated that Finland would not negotiate with Turkey, while the Swedish Prime Minister emphasized NATO's role in strengthening Sweden in the new European reality.
events.description: The Finnish foreign minister stated that Finland would not negotiate with Turkey, while the Swedish Prime Minister emphasized NATO's role in strengthening Sweden in the new European reality.

events.name: U.S. addresses EV battery supply chain challenges
events.wd_label: U.S. addresses EV battery supply chain challenges
events.wd_description: The Biden administration is addressing EV battery supply chain challenges through the DOE's new Battery Policies and Incentives database, developed by NREL, to advance zero-emission vehicle adoption and secure a domestic battery supply chain.
events.description: The Biden administration is addressing EV battery supply chain challenges through the DOE's new Battery Policies and Incentives database, developed by NREL, to advance zero-emission vehicle adoption and secure a domestic battery supply chain.

events.name: Database purpose and coverage
events.wd_description: The database helps inform EV battery production and development of a secure domestic battery supply chain, covering activities before and after battery use such as materials production, manufacturing, and transport.
events.description: The database helps inform EV battery production and development of a secure domestic battery supply chain, covering activities before and after battery use such as materials production, manufacturing, and transport.

events.name: Database audience
events.wd_description: The database is aimed at federal, state, and local policymakers, businesses, and individuals looking to build key businesses in the U.S. Li-ion battery supply chain.
events.description: The database is aimed at federal, state, and local policymakers, businesses, and individuals looking to build key businesses in the U.S. Li-ion battery supply chain.

events.name: NREL's role
events.wd_description: NREL's expertise in maintaining national data sets was key in developing the database, enhancing aspects such as a public database for users to understand battery laws and incentives across states.
events.description: NREL's expertise in maintaining national data sets was key in developing the database, enhancing aspects such as a public database for users to understand battery laws and incentives across states.

events.name: Importance of batteries
events.wd_description: Batteries are crucial for decarbonizing the economy, expanding grid storage, improving resilience, and increasing transportation electrification. Demand for EVs and storage is projected to multiply the Li-ion battery market.
events.description: Batteries are crucial for decarbonizing the economy, expanding grid storage, improving resilience, and increasing transportation electrification. Demand for EVs and storage is projected to multiply the Li-ion battery market.

events.name: Executive order response
events.wd_description: In response to a White House executive order, DOE recommended establishing a domestic battery supply chain, with FCAB initially identifying the need for access to relevant laws, regulations, policies, and incentives.
events.description: In response to a White House executive order, DOE recommended establishing a domestic battery supply chain, with FCAB initially identifying the need for access to relevant laws, regulations, policies, and incentives.

events.name: Collaboration and contributions
events.wd_description: NREL and ICF are building the database, with NREL leading technology development and ICF contributing research. DOE's Vehicle Technologies Office and NAATBatt International provide user perspective input.
events.description: NREL and ICF are building the database, with NREL leading technology development and ICF contributing research. DOE's Vehicle Technologies Office and NAATBatt International provide user perspective input.

events.name: Stakeholder awareness and investment
events.wd_description: The database helps stakeholders understand existing regulations for the battery life cycle and supply chain, identifying needs and creating opportunities for private sector investment.
events.description: The database helps stakeholders understand existing regulations for the battery life cycle and supply chain, identifying needs and creating opportunities for private sector investment.

events.name: National Blueprint for Lithium Batteries
events.wd_description: FCAB's National Blueprint for Lithium Batteries includes recommendations for domestic research, industrial base development, improved materials processing, reduced reliance on outside markets, and enhanced domestic processing capacity.
events.description: FCAB's National Blueprint for Lithium Batteries includes recommendations for domestic research, industrial base development, improved materials processing, reduced reliance on outside markets, and enhanced domestic processing capacity.

events.name: Sustainable sourcing and processing
events.wd_description: The supply chain will include sustainable sourcing and processing of critical minerals, with the U.S. aiming to fully source all aspects domestically and rely on recycling for a circular economy.
events.description: The supply chain will include sustainable sourcing and processing of critical minerals, with the U.S. aiming to fully source all aspects domestically and rely on recycling for a circular economy.

events.name: Bipartisan Infrastructure Law
events.wd_description: The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law includes funding to explore domestic capabilities for battery supply chain components and new processes for recycling materials to add back into the supply chain.
events.description: The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law includes funding to explore domestic capabilities for battery supply chain components and new processes for recycling materials to add back into the supply chain.

events.name: Database development and relevance
events.wd_description: The database is based on an established Federal and State Laws and Incentives database, with NREL and ICF applying existing methodologies to track battery life cycle policies and incentives.
events.description: The database is based on an established Federal and State Laws and Incentives database, with NREL and ICF applying existing methodologies to track battery life cycle policies and incentives.

events.name: Future growth and input
events.wd_description: The database will grow as new topic areas emerge, and data entries will evolve. The development team welcomes input on areas users would like to see covered.
events.description: The database will grow as new topic areas emerge, and data entries will evolve. The development team welcomes input on areas users would like to see covered.
